Flu.title: Give or refuse consent for a flu vaccination
Flu.description: The vaccination helps to protect children against flu. It also protects others who are vulnerable to flu, such as babies and older people.

HPV.title: Give or refuse consent for an HPV vaccination
HPV.description:
The HPV vaccine helps to prevent HPV related cancers from developing in boys and girls.

The number of doses you need depends on your age and how well your immune system works. Young people usually only need 1 dose.

3-in-1 teenage booster and MenACWY.title: Give or refuse consent for the 3-in-1 teenage booster and MenACWY vaccine
3-in-1 teenage booster and MenACWY.description:
The 3-in-1 teenage booster, also known as the Td/IPV vaccine, boosts protection against 3 diseases: tetanus, diptheria and polio.

The MenACWY vaccine, which helps to prevent meningitis and septicaemia, is normally given at the same time as the 3-in-1.

Both vaccines are offered to all young people aged 13 to 15 (in school Years 9 and 10). They’re given as injections into the upper arm.

language.title: Use this service in another language

closed.title: You can no longer use this service
closed.description:
The deadline for responding has passed. This means you can no longer take part in the pilot.

If you have any questions, you can contact {{organisation.email}}.

unavailable.title: You cannot give or refuse consent through this service
unavailable.description:
This service is being piloted with a small number of schools. It’s only for parents whose children attend participating schools.

If you have any questions, please contact the local health team by calling 01234 321456, or email <england.manage-childrens-vaccinations@nhs.net>.

child.description: Give the official name that’s on their passport or birth certificate. If their name has changed, tell us their current name.

description.Given:
We’ll send a confirmation once the vaccination has been given.

If the vaccination does not take place due to illness or absence, we’ll contact you about a catch-up session.

invite.label: Invitation
invite.name: Inviting parent to give or refuse consent
invite.text:
Give or refuse consent for your child’s {{campaign.type}} vaccination by going to [https://give-or-refuse-consent.nhs.uk/{{session.id}}](/consents/{{session.id}}). You need to do this by {{session.formatted.close}}.

Responding will take less than 5 minutes.

invite-reminder.label: Reminder
invite-reminder.name: Reminding parent to give or refuse consent
invite-reminder.text:
We recently asked for your consent to vaccinate your child against {{campaign.type}}.

Go to [https://give-or-refuse-consent.nhs.uk/{{session.id}}](/consents/{{session.id}}) to submit a response. This will take less than 5 minutes.

consent-given.label: Consent given
consent-given.name: Confirmation that consent has been given
consent-given.text: You’ve given consent for {{consent.child.firstName}} to get their {{campaign.type}} vaccination at school on {{session.formatted.date}}. Please let them know what to expect.

consent-given-child.label: Consent given
consent-given-child.name: Confirmation that consent has been given
consent-given-child.text: Your parent or guardian has agreed for you to have the {{campaign.type}} vaccination at school on {{session.formatted.date}}.

consent-refused.label: Consent refused
consent-refused.name: Confirmation that consent has been refused
consent-refused.text: You’ve refused to give consent for {{consent.child.fullName}} to have their {{campaign.type}} vaccination. Please let them know they will not be vaccinated at school.

session-reminder.label: Session reminder
session-reminder.name: Reminder (to go out the day before the vaccination)
session-reminder.text: {{consent.child.firstName}} will get their {{campaign.type}} vaccination at school tomorrow ({{session.formatted.date}}). Please make sure they have breakfast and encourage them to wear a short-sleeved shirt.

session-reminder-child.label: Session reminder
session-reminder-child.name: Reminder (to go out the day before the vaccination)
session-reminder-child.text: You’re due to get your {{campaign.type}} vaccination at school tomorrow ({{session.formatted.date}}). Please wear a short-sleeved shirt and make sure you eat something before the session.

session-outcome-vaccinated.label: Vaccinated
session-outcome-vaccinated.name: Child has been vaccinated
session-outcome-vaccinated.text:
{{consent.child.firstName}} had their {{campaign.type}} vaccination at school today. They might have some side effects, including bruising or itching at the injection site, a high temperature, nausea, or pain in the arms, hands, or fingers.

If you’re concerned, contact your GP in the usual way.

session-outcome-could-not-vaccinate.label: Could not vaccinate
session-outcome-could-not-vaccinate.name: Child did not get their vaccination despite having consent
session-outcome-could-not-vaccinate.text:
{{consent.child.firstName}} did not have their {{campaign.type}} vaccination at school today. This was because {{reason}}.

If you’d still like them to be vaccinated on a different date, contact the local health team by calling [{{organisation.tel}}](#), or email [{{organisation.email}}](#).

outcome.label: Outcome
outcome.DelayVaccination: No, delay vaccination to a later date
